filtered: The longer you wait, the sweeter it is. It’s a reminder that patience can often lead to more rewarding experiences, as we learn to appreciate the journey and the small moments along the way. Slow rain persists, creating a serene atmosphere that prompts reflection. Even when faced with challenges like timing and logistics, it’s important to heed wise counsel, as my mother suggests to rest. Respecting nature and finding joy in the present can be as crucial as the ambitions we chase, such as Niptic's excitement about a new start-up.

filtered: The decision often presents itself between indulgence and moderation - be it in work, conversation, or nourishment. Striving for balance can lead to moments of contemplation, and sometimes it's beneficial to postpone decisions rather than act impulsively. During periods of rest, the mind can reset, allowing one to awaken rejuvenated and ready to engage with the world anew. This experience underscores the importance of stepping back to clear one's mind, enabling a fresh perspective and better choices moving forward.
original_entry: The choice seems to present itself Smoke (work, talk n1ptic, etc) or eat (momentarily free CPU, but dukkha bringing) But still feel little full for both eating or smoking I don't want fall into excess either So i postpone it little bit "Lets talk later, N." Eventually fall asleep on the chair In sleep, all firewalls drop CPU free's Wake up 1 hour later - without any memory loaded into CPU, firewalls, beliefs, statisical data&predictions, etc - The Body wakes up and eats

filtered: As needs arise, it encourages one to engage in meaningful work. Acknowledging and understanding the root cause of an issue can significantly alleviate the stress associated with it. Once clarity is achieved, the fear surrounding the situation diminishes, allowing for adaptability and growth within the mind and body. Without fear, there is no longer a compulsion to abandon goals or desires. Instead, one realizes that everything is inherently valuable and can be nurtured and repaired through understanding and effort.
original_entry: As the 'need' arose, it seems it make him truly do some dhamma work Scooter fixed <3 How beautiful it starts now, begin to have complete trust in it Once everything is seen, exactly what is causing the issue, the issue is half solved Now i don't fear it anymore - abandonim me - or even if it does - the Mind&Body can adapt again, fix, learn Without fear, there is no urge to sell anymore But use It's already perfect And it was opened up, understood, repaired by these Hands

filtered: In this process, I have discovered the beauty of the afternoon dhamma activity, reminding me to be mindful of the day and hour. While studying the electrical patterns with my father, I realized that everything can be reduced to 0s and 1s, revealing the elegance in simplicity. I appreciate how my father provides me with the necessary tools and allows me to explore on my own. Tomorrow, I will assemble Anapanasati, and I've come to find that my breath feels incredibly beautiful now. As I start from Step 1, I am contemplating the experience of the short breath. Although it feels forced and involves significant effort from my abdomen, I recognize the power and importance of this practice.
original_entry: In this process, i have discovered an afternoon dhamma activity pool Only have to mind the day & hour ---Studying the electrical pattern with Father--- Everything is 0s and 1s Wow Its beautiful how father merely gives me the tools - and let's me work Tomorrow will assemble Anapanasati - breath feels so beautiful now Starting from Step 1 Contemplating the Short breath It's so forced So much work has to be done by the abdomen Now teh powerful short breath

filtered: Writing can serve as a powerful tool for self-regulation and emotional release. As the act of writing unfolds, it facilitates a calming of the breath and the mind, creating a serene space where rapture can emerge. This experience highlights the transformative nature of writing, enabling a natural flow that leads to tranquility and relaxation throughout the body. Embracing this process can open pathways to deeper understanding and serenity within oneself.
original_entry: The moment i start to write the breath attempts to calm down Then i calm down in the Mind again ANd Write It kweeps calming again Like system overw-rites Writing Becomes so Muc Piti So much much rapture So intense Not content But not fearful either Rapture is the best word Of all flavors HItting hard the keyboard THe cycles finally hit a natural end The breath calms down Inside of KS feels warm now On all body travels a wave of tranquility Of calm Relaxing all bodies

filtered: Also, Spinu plays a role in this alchemy, illustrating how much our environment influences our healing journeys. While Spinu can offer guidance, it is ultimately up to us to address our suffering. Like repairing a scooter, the process involves patience and continuous learning—making mistakes, laying down, and experimenting with new angles and tools. The experience becomes extraordinary as we slowly dismantle and reassemble, gaining a deeper understanding with each screw and click. The mind's capability to learn and adapt grows significantly through practice; we learn best when we embrace failures and adapt accordingly.
original_entry: Also Spinu plays a part in this alchemy, but it is extraordinarily dependent on environment - Spinu can advise but cannot fix the suffering ---The Mechanic--- Scooter Surgery Slowly learning, making mistakes, laying down, finding new angles, new tools - it is extraordinary Father has bought the needed semi-moon and kickstart And slowly, screw by screw, click by click, the body of the scooter comes off The Mind's capability has vastly increased since last time i did it, a few days ago Learn alone Fail Adapt

original_entry: It instantly reacts to X pattern - slowly but surely building up with exposure time Position III Lean on table with chest Full elbow and arms support KS4 X pattern addressed as long as anchor in elbow is maintained But at every release of the anchors, as the hands need to reach some further keys, gravity instantly shifts from elbow and chest - to T-Spine, becoming an X pattern What an intimate dance with gravity From all, this is by far the most comfortable one here This i shall use, but carefully

filtered: Work on the scooter continues, and I am considering building a wooden table. However, I am facing a bottleneck in deciding whether to prioritize plant storage and drying. I remind myself to stick to my plan and trust my previous thought patterns. It's essential not to overthink the specifics, as there are too many variables at play. I should let things unfold naturally, just like writing flows on the page. Good morning, my friend.
original_entry: Work on scooter continues Also, maybe build wooden table This hits a little bottleneck regarding if i should make plants storage and drying Drying first, my friend, stick to the plan Trust the previous Mind patterns Don't think too much about size and others, because they are way too many variables at play Let it work itself Just like the writing writes iself Good morning, my friend

filtered: The experience of grappling with dukkha, or suffering, often illuminates profound truths about our existence. As I navigated through the challenges of digestion and fatigue, the teachings from Bhikku served as a guiding light, echoing the wisdom I encountered during my time in Thailand. Recognizing that dukkha persists serves as a reminder to cultivate resilience and awareness in our lives. Each struggle provides an opportunity to connect deeper with the essence of our being and the universal truths that bind us all.
original_entry: - Yardi.exe - Log time & Emily CPR (unknown and bottlenecks of dukkha - slowly) 7 June - Eate 1/2 jar of oats Very hard to digest at night Sleep 11-5 - wake up little bit but very tired, and sleep again KS2 dukkha persists as well as KS Wake up feeling pretty weak all around the body Studying Unveiling the Secrets of Life with Bhikku Again the same feeling as when i was in thailand, a way of Bhikku speaking the core truth of all things - right into the heart of one's being

filtered: The place where all systems converge is the Unspeakable world, where one can observe assada and adinava in everything around. As I sit on the balcony in the evening, engaging in my dhamma work, I find a sense of calm within my body and mind. It's 8 PM, and while I contemplate a trip to Tauti with Canu and my girlfriend, I ultimately decide to stay home. There's comfort in sipping warm tea with a touch of honey and milk, and in the act of writing, if inspiration strikes. I truly love working on this presentation, as it serves as a form of healing. I also chose to let go of the remaining chocolate and buns, embracing clarity and freedom from dukkha.
original_entry: The place where all systems meet - the Unspeakable world - Seeing assada and adinava - in all things Here, on the balcony, in the evening, doing one's dhamma work - the body & mind calm down 8pm Contemplating on going to Tauti with Canu and girlfriend Let's stay home, my friend Sip a warm tea with little honey and milk. and write - if Writing comes, of course Man i love to work on this presentation Just opening it. it Heals Threw away rest of chocolate and buns Clear clear dukkha

filtered: The art of nourishing the body and soul hinges on listening to oneself, especially after experiencing emotional turmoil. Instead of succumbing to excessive hunger or discomfort (dukkha), one should practice gentle self-care by providing just enough sustenance to restore balance. Whether it’s a few spoonfuls of chia pudding or a small portion of cereals, the key is moderation and mindfulness in our approach to nourishment.
original_entry: Pelicanu's work on site is exquisite Requires little to not input from me 6 June - ----Taming the Beast----- ----The little bite in case the KS2 echoes too much dukkha---- At night, after a heavy dukkha episode on KS2, it may meet the night hungry, un-nourished The dhamma is to not force the body into hunger and acid, but gently support it with just little, little food in the kitchen, taming the beast Eate 2-3 spoons of chia pudding and one shot of cereals - clear dukkha in cereals

filtered: The practice of respecting the principles of food and evening routines can have a profound impact on one's life. Even maintaining only a 50% adherence to these principles can reveal the interconnectedness of natural truths and inspire positive change. By fully embracing and committing to this dhamma, individuals may experience significant healing and transformation, as well as a reduction in daily expenses, ultimately leading to a more fulfilling and balanced life.
original_entry: I truly cannot remember the last time when i respected the dhamma of food and evening life for 4 days straight - with on and off Only 50% And it's effect is so extraordinarily strong. Only 50% it can Heal anything, it feels Bring light to 100% of the micro-levels of happenings, the binding of Natural Truths, and respect them only 50% And One's life will change A Tear and a Smile Card is here In this dhamma way of eating, daily costs have greatly dropped Card arrived <3

filtered: In navigating the complexities of spending and the nature of desire, we must approach our choices with mindfulness. When we purchase items, especially from sources like Temu and Aliexpress, it is essential to reflect on the deeper meaning behind our expenditures. Instead of succumbing to greed, we should nurture and care for the aspects of our lives that truly matter—the connections between Body, Mind, and Spirit. By pondering what our money truly buys us, we can align our spending with values that enrich our well-being rather than contribute to stress and dissatisfaction. Embracing this art of ordering with intention fosters a sense of togetherness in our lives.
original_entry: Temu and Aliexpress orders - bring little money dukkha - but let's meet it with the feeling of being home, in this togetherness of Body, Mind and Spirit In nomine Patris et Filii et Spiritus Sancti Let's order my dear friend Job is extraordinarily fueling everything But also take care of your litta flower, little bit Don't give into greed What do these money buy - the question must always be pondered If money is not spento on dukkha food, everything is well The Art of Ordering from China
